SEARCH
Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
The Portfolio class manages a collection of investments (either Stock or MutualFund). It provides methods for adding, removing, and updating investments, as well as reading from and writing to files. Additionally, the class maintains a keyword index for searching investments.

  • Constructor Details

    • Portfolio

      public Portfolio()
      Default constructor for the Portfolio class.

  • Method Details

    • writeInvestment

      public void writeInvestment(String f_Name)
      Writes the current investments to the specified file.
      Parameters:
      f_Name - The file name where investments will be written.

    • readInvestments

      public void readInvestments(String f_Name)
      Reads investments from the specified file and adds them to the portfolio. The file format must contain information about the investment type, symbol, name, quantity, price, and book value.
      Parameters:
      f_Name - The file name from which investments will be read.

    • buy

      public static String buy(String type, String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price)
      Buys a new investment (either stock or mutual fund) and adds it to the portfolio. If an investment with the same symbol already exists, it updates the existing investment.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of investment ("stock" or "mutualfund").
      symbol - The symbol of the investment (e.g., stock ticker).
      name - The name of the investment.
      quantity - The quantity to buy.
      price - The price per unit of the investment.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the success or failure of the purchase.

    • sell

      public static String sell(String symbol, int quantity, double price)
      Sells a specified quantity of shares from an investment and returns the payment received.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the investment to sell.
      quantity - The quantity of shares to sell.
      price - The price at which the shares are sold.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the result of the sale.

    • update

      public static String update(Investment investment1, double newPrice)
      Updates the price of an investment and returns the updated details.
      Parameters:
      investment1 - The investment to be updated.
      newPrice - The new price for the investment.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the successful update and details of the investment.

    • getGain

      public static String getGain()
      Calculates and returns the total gain of all investments.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the total gain.

    • getSingleGain

      public static String getSingleGain()
      Returns the individual gain of each investment in a formatted string.
      Returns:
      A string containing individual gains for each investment.

    • search

      public static String search(String symbol, String keywordString, double priceLow, double priceHigh)
      Searches for investments based on symbol, keywords, and price range.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the investment to search for.
      keywordString - The keywords to filter investments.
      priceLow - The minimum price of the investment.
      priceHigh - The maximum price of the investment.
      Returns:
      A string containing all the matching investments.

    • checkifString

      public static boolean checkifString(String string, boolean required)
      Checks if a string is non-empty if required.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to check.
      required - If the string is required to be non-empty.
      Returns:
      True if the string is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkifInt

      public static boolean checkifInt(String string, boolean required)
      Checks if a string can be converted to an integer.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to check.
      required - If the string is required to be a valid integer.
      Returns:
      True if the string is a valid integer, false otherwise.

    • checkIfDouble

      public static boolean checkIfDouble(String string, boolean required)
      Checks if a string can be converted to a double.
      Parameters:
      string - The string to check.
      required - If the string is required to be a valid double.
      Returns:
      True if the string is a valid double, false otherwise.

    • findInvestment

      public static int findInvestment(String symbol)
      Finds the index of an investment by its symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the investment to search for.
      Returns:
      The index of the investment, or -1 if not found.

    • printInvestments

      public static String printInvestments()
      Prints a summary of all investments, categorized into stocks and mutual funds.
      Returns:
      a formatted string containing the investments' details

    • getInvestment

      public static Investment getInvestment(int index)
      Retrieves the investment at the given index from the list.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the investment
      Returns:
      the investment at the specified index, or a default value if the list is empty

    • getInvestListSize

      public static int getInvestListSize()
      Returns the current size of the investments list.
      Returns:
      the size of the investments list

    • getFileName

      public static String getFileName()
      Returns the file name where the portfolio data is saved. This method provides the current file name used for saving the portfolio data.
      Returns:
      the file name (String)
